Extract Table Results from DuckDB

Source: R/UrlScraper_utils_results.R
dot-extract_results.Rd

Retrieves records from one of the internal DuckDB tables used by the UrlScraper framework. Supported tables include:

  • "results" – scraped HTML documents

  • "logs" – worker progress log entries

  • "links" – extracted hyperlinks

Optional SQL-style filtering is supported (e.g., "url LIKE 'https://example.com/%'").

Usage

.extract_results(db_file, tab = "results", filter)

Arguments

db_file

Path to the DuckDB file created by the scraper.

tab

Character scalar specifying the table to query. Must be one of "results", "logs", or "links".

filter

Optional SQL WHERE clause (without the word WHERE) used to subset the results.

Value

A data.table containing all rows from the selected table, optionally filtered. Returns NULL invisibly if the query fails.

Details

This helper function:

  • Connects to the DuckDB database in read‑only mode

  • Validates the requested table name

  • Constructs a SELECT * FROM <table> query, optionally with a WHERE clause

  • Returns results as a data.table

If the underlying query fails (often due to malformed filters), an informative message is printed and NULL is returned invisibly.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
## Extract all scraped results:
.extract_results("results.duckdb", tab = "results")

## Extract links from a specific domain:
.extract_results("results.duckdb", tab = "links",
                  filter = "href LIKE 'https://example.com/%'")
} # }
